title: Love netatmo
text: We have had our Netatmo for several years and I love it. We live in the Denver metro area where temperatures and weather conditions can vary greatly across the area. I can check the temperature outside my house and then look at the temps across the area. I can see how much colder it is in the mountains than on the plains or between where I live and Boulder (this is in the map portion of the app). If you swipe left in the app, you can see pollution levels (helpful if you like to exercise outdoors). I love how the device warns you when the CO2 level is too high in your house. I also like that I can see noise levels. The app will alert you to any hazardous weather conditions in your area if you turn on the alerts. We recently purchased and installed the wind and rain gauge. Hopefully, we will love them as well. I find Netatmo an extremely useful device.

title: Notifications still not 100%
text:
Notifications appear again, for the most part. The alert badge on the app icon does not yet work. (Yes, I have notifications set to add the badge and have toggled it off and on and still nothing). 

Old review, but still true...
The temperatures are highly inaccurate. It was in the low 80's yet they listed the "Feels Like" temperature at 117. The temperatures on all units are off by about 2-2.7 degrees. Still no way to initiate an immediate reading from the app. You must rely on old data or physically access the base station to request a reading. The additional units lack in functionality. I thought they included decibel meters but they are only inaccurate thermometers and supposedly measure CO2 levels. Those are also insanely inaccurate. Their support department takes about a week to respond and doesn't actually help you with the issue. I'd avoid the app unless you are only wanting inaccurate temperature readings. The other information is ridiculously inaccurate or just completely fabricated. I hate my Netatmo paperweights.

title: Great App, grossly misrepresented in '1 star' reviews
text:
As found by the most reviewer, I've had no problems on iOS 9 and beta 9.1 and the properly uses the screen real-estate on iPhone 6, or 6+ as well as both current iPads.  As to 'tips' the user just needs to disable them. Or if you find you can't reinstall the App. My install has not shown them since the original installs. I find it a great intuitive app and as a developer has a very usable well architected UI. As a former Naval Aviator and weather nut I've installed 2 systems already at home and a family vacation home. It's a must have 'gadget' and app.
Added in July 2020
Still love the system and the software has only gotten better with each release.

title: Everything you need for climate monitoring
text:
I have used this appliance for measuring performance of the vent systems and monitoring kindergarten indoor climate.

To say that I'm happy with this tool is to say nothing. It's just awesome.

I was afraid at first that CO2 sensor is not showing good results (I have checked against verified Autopilot and CO2Meter devices), but it all went back to nominal when device self-calibration was over (there's a mark on the device homepage when calibration is in progress).

I also found sound meter extremely helpful in my measurements, because noise is one of the critical aspects of the vent system functioning.

It was also helpful that device stored data internally when the connection failed so I did not loose my measurement data for several days.

I found the web-interface a bit difficult to scroll for long periods of time, so more graphana-like interface is welcome. Yet at the moment it can be worked around by exporting the data in csv and importing it in any analytics tool.

Good product. Looking forward for new updates.

title: This is a joke
text:
Get my station today set everything up nothing works.   Changed batteries on all mods deleted and reinstalled get to work for 1 minute then goes offline. Settings show good signal strength all around but rain and outside sensor not transmitting info. How does this company not have a phone number to call or troubleshooting and or customer service? Very disappointed sent email hopefully I will update this with good news after I hear back from them.

Update. I was able to get my system online although I had to essentially put the outdoor station next to the window where the indoor station is. Customer service is the only reason I am giving them 3 stars. I’ve asked several follow up questions.m 6 hours ago and haven’t received a response. CS phone line is a must in today’s digital world.

title: Frustrated
text: We have a Netatmo indoor station, an outdoor thermometer, and a rain gauge. Outdoor Thermometer constantly loses connection even though we follow the directions for connectivity and placement. We change batteries each time it disconnects, but it still disconnects frequently. The directions are not clear with instructions stating to go to settings and follow directions on box???? Who has the box handy. We need online directions that are logical. The outdoor thermometer will not connect now no matter where we place it. Flashes green light. If only I  had the box, maybe I could figure it out. The rain gauge clogs with leaves and pine needles. Does not read any rain whatsoever eleven when we bring it indoors, clean it out, and run tap water through it. No directions available on battery replacement procedure. Again, online manual says, follow directions on box. Ridiculous...

title: Netatmo weather station
text:
I’ve been testing out a couple of smart devices for the past year, some socket control, other lighting.
When I came to Netatmo, the product had a very sleek design, the units were very simple, I thought I’m not gonna have a quality product, as the manufacturing did not look very robust.
But, when I started using the weather station, the results were fabulous, the readings are super accurate, the interface is slick and beautiful.
I love what these guys are doing with their products, I have the full range of thermostat and heat control units now and can’t wait to set them up.

title: Enjoying My Netatmo Weather Station with Wind & Rain Gauge
text:
This was a present for old Dad from my sons.  I like to be able to know if 10 inches dumped on my house when I’m traveling.  Set up was easy and without incident.  I did have to reset the outdoor module once, not sure why.  I purchased an additional indoor module for my unattached heated garage.  The wind gauge is mounted at the highpoint on my house roof.

It’s winter here, but we have warm spell and supposed to get rain, so I’m excited to see the rain gauge work.  

I also own two Netatmo cameras:  Presence (mounted on my garage with motion detector flood light camera) and Welcome (interior camera with facial recognition).  Very happy with both products.  Had an issue with the Mini SD card on the Presence, Netatmo’s customer service was excellent in supplying me a new card to resolve the issue.

Also, cool to see the other folks around the world and in my home town that also have the Netatmo weather set-up.

title: Great Product!
text: I like everything about my Netamo weather station. I have a base station, a rain gauge, and a wind gauge. They all work great and seem to be accurate. The app has worked perfectly from day one. It didn’t install according to the instructions, but it seems rare for any software product to do so. I still got it going by myself in an hour or so without having to call tech support. The only improvement would be to make the rain gauge and wind gauge values accessible from HomeKit...they are currently not available.

title: Fun and amazing
text:
Did you know you make more CO2 when awake? Is the heat working when you are away? How fast did the air pressure drop during that bomb cyclone? How good is the insulation in your house - how fast does it approach outdoor temp when you turn off the heat or a/c?
Is anyone at the house? 
All these and many more are at your fingertips.
Ok a bit nerdy but easy to imagine saving on heat or cooling by wise venting and minimizing when nobody home.
I was amazed how high the CO2 got during a party. Help the party atmosphere with some venting, and all can have a better time even if they don’t know what changed.

title: Too many issues
text: When I first set up my Netatmo weather station I was very pleased. I would update temperature, humidity, etc. even 12 minutes. I was impressed enough that I bought an additional indoor module and then a second one. I also added the rain and wind (anemometer). It the last year or so I have repeated periods when I get no updates from the weather station. It can go for over an hour, even 2 hours. I do not find it useful to know what them temperature was over an hour ago. In the summer I want to know in the evenings when it has cooled down enough that I can open my windows. Conveniently that seems to be when I get no updates. The standard answer from tech support is that there is a sever issue and they are working on it. I cannot recommend this product.

title: Very nice addition to Weather Station
text: I really like the rain gauge as I can see how much rain is happening right now and the forecast rain and the amount of rain received so far.  The gauge empties itself automatically. I don’t have it mounted permanently yet but I bought the separate arm to connect to a pole or something else.  Very cool tech.  Easy to pair with weather station.  It just works.  Anemometer works great too providing real time wind information. The wind and rain gauge are installed on a flagpole and they work.

title: Nice Reliable Weather System
text:
I have had this weather station for about 2+ years now and I have owned others but this one stands out from all the rest.
It always stays online and updates the weather station automatically. The only downside about this weather station 
Is that it is a bit pricey to get-but once you buy it that’s all you will need to have a good reliable WIFI Weather Station that will last for years to come.

RNR

title: Perfect remote weather station
text: We use Netatmo to keep track of indoor and outdoor conditions at our remote weekend Cabin in the Woods. We are able to use the Cabin year round without extensive winterization/shutdown by being able to monitor indoor temperature and humidity.  We can take action when needed to avoid frozen pipes in the winter and humidity buildup in the summer. Tracking heavy wind and rain helps us anticipate power outages. We love the system for both Home and Cabin weather information. Easy setup, easy operation.  Amazing number of stations reporting worldwide.

title: Wifi setup buggy
text: I’ve had my device for many years and happy with it and the app iterations as well. I was just using the updated app earlier today to add some custom notifications. Five hours later and the device lost its network connection, which hasn’t happened since a planned power outage about 2 weeks ago. Following the new app directions to set the wifi and I keep getting prompted to select an accessory from an empty list. The app doesn’t allow me to set the wifi. Now I have a paper weight. Can vendors please make sure to thoroughly test apps before releasing them?

title: Mountain Netatmo
text: At first when I got my Netatmo weather station it installed just fine.  I added the rain and wind gauges.  Had trouble installing one of them and after analysis with Netatmo support they sent me a new module.  The weather station has been functioning very well since.  I would recommend this station to anyone who is a pro or amateur meteorologist.  My station readings are used by others to look at the weather in the area when they are away.

title: I love this product and app!
text: I love this weather station and app, especially since it is HomeKit friendly. I can check the temp at my house and I can easily figure out what is happening at my house. If you are making a HomeKit friendly house and you are also a weather geek, this is the product for you!  If you get the alert that it is below freezing, you can close blinds and turn up a thermostat, to save on energy costs.

title: Great product but tricky to install
text: This app and the associated smart weather station with rain gauge is a great product once you get it installed.  The user manual is pretty good, but it wasn't clear to me that you need to reinsert the batteries of all accessories immediately before trying to link them to the indoor base module and that that linkage must take place while the two devices are close enough together to almost be touching.  If the green LED is not flashing at the precise moment you begin pairing, the operation will fail.  Very delicate process.

title: Accurate and reliable.
text:
I live in a rural area with occasional power outages. I have two cats; when temps are in the 100s and an outage knocks out my A/C (which does not come back on automatically) I want to know about it so I can run home and turn it back on. Netatmo was easy to install and has given me peace of mind. 

I’m also kind of a weather geek with a weather-dependent job, so it’s nice to have a super-local recording site that I can check from anywhere. Definitely recommend.

title: Netatmo weather station
text: Netatmo is fantastic app and weather gathering system.  You can get the temperature wherever in or out of your house immediately including a graph of temperature, humidity, co2, and noise on main station.  The rain gage is also convenient and quite accurate.  I haven’t tried the wind gage because I don’t really have a place to put it.  It’s much more helpful to have the weather at your home than 20 miles away and you can access it from anywhere.

title: Wonderful weather station
text:
When I received this as a gift from my children I thought it was nice. But I wasnt sure what it really did.
It provides a large amount of information that I didnt know I needed and now I love having this much data on the interior of the home as well as the ability to drill down on whats really going on outside. So specific, not general. 
A wonderful addition to my home and to life.

title: Work as described
text: The iOS netatmo weather station application. contains amazing feature performance that provides up to date weather information wireless communication. But through all of the technological side of the product. their is something definitely missing from all of the user experience. And that Clearly is the general stability of the application

title: Better way to graph the rain data.
text: First of all, I love the Netatmo Weather station and the app. The only complaint I have is the rain data is hard to look back and see how much was accumulated for that entire day. Currently your going to have to go hour by hour and add it up yourself. I wish the current graph would stay but also have an additional way of historically seeing accumulated rain for the entire day, week, month, etc.

title: Really Enjoying it a lot
text: The apps are easy to use and understand. The modules (I have the core station plus the wind and rain modules). They just disappear which is great. I have a basic highly accurate rain gauge in my backyard as well and the difference between is never more than 0.025. We have been extremely pleased. The thing I wish they would add next is a Watch app (with complications) as well as widgets for iOS 14, otherwise it fantastic!!

title: Works well
text: I’ll keep this short but it works well. No set up issues and had to reconnect one module once in 6-months. Gives us peace of mind when (pre-Covid) traveling as well.  Data retention also very useful too if you’re into to that (e.g. was able to use the temp data details to determine that my waking up in the middle of the night was due to the temp set too high).

title: Very reliable, very accurate
text: We’ve had two of these for about two years and are very happy with them. The one at home helps monitor the weather inside and out while we are away, and the one at the beach house we use to monitor temp and humidity inside only to make sure the heat/ac are working, and that the dehumidifier is doing its job when no one is around. Considering getting more modules.

title: Support!!!!
text:
I've had the Netatmo since it came out. Have the Rain Gauge and just bought the Wind Gauge. The unit has worked amazingly since I've had it!!! 

I had some problems with the wind gauge. I have to say that the support team has been nothing but the best for me and thought I should mention it! They took care of the wind gauge right away and sent me a new unit. They have answered all my questions which have been many. For me they have been nothing but the best, especially Prashanth!!!

title: Fantastic but system failing lately
text: A most wonderful system, a dream come true, as long as the system’s servers are functional. I’ve used multiple products for several years. The system went down during a the past few severe storms and during marginal mixed ice, snow and rain events: very bad timing. But this has happened several times! Lots of connectivity problems in the past few weeks, including a few full or half-day outages. When it works, and it usually does, it is truly fantastic. But, if you depend on it, and it is not there...ugh.  When it is reliable, I will happily update my review and rating (back to five stars).

title: Can’t live without it
text: I have a Boat that stays in the water year round without being winterized. I have heaters in the engine compartment and living area. When I’m home I could make multiple trips to the marina to check temperatures. But when I travel away how would I know if everything was warm. With Netatmo I can monitor temperatures from 10 miles away or 1100 mikes away. Support is also good

title: Graph data availability spotty
text:
The graphs aren’t always available when using this app.  

When I use the Myatmo app, they are able to reliably access the data and display the graphs, so I don’t see why Netatmo’s own app has trouble so often.
—————
After rebooting the weather station, it seems to be displaying the graphs fine now.

title: Health sleep
text:
Monitoring indoor CO2 levels is critical for getting a good night’s sleep and keeping waking appetites from driving weight gain.  NETATMO is a simple system for keeping tabs on the health of our indoor air.  We get to know when to open the windows to keep night time temperatures from disturbing our sleep and by how much CO2 levels fall as a result.

Simple.

title: Reliable information
text: Built a new house and the additional indoor one helps balance the zones. Informative local weather from other stations in your region and the USA. Helps planning for your day or week and travel. Would love to have an additional one outside, very different on either side of the house.  Just love it.

title: Useful History- Reliable Graphs
text: Received the weather station as a gift but would buy it.  The app is surprisingly good for current and historical measurements. Helpful to see the trends. I like how it intuitively changes the sample time-period based on a pinch to zoom in or out of the measurement window from an hour to a month.

title: Love
text:
I have had A Netatmo since the year it was introduced.   I added a wind and rain sensor in addition to two indoor stations. 

I love the product.  It’s great to be able to see the actual outdoor temperature, indoor CO levels, rain gauge for watering plants and lawn.

Being able to see the wind speed, and secure patio furniture and outdoor items in windstorms is perfect.

I’ve never had a single issue with any of my devices although my original outdoor sensor did die after around 6 years of sitting outside every day in sun, heat, snow, etc which is a lot longer than I’d get out of most electronics.  Particular if left in the elements.

title: Love the products and services
text: I’ve been using this setup for years.  My only complaint is that you can only have 3 additional modules. I have an old house with lots of small rooms so I’d like to get 8 or more modules but the system won’t support it as of yet.  (Please support more modules so I can give you more $$$)

title: Great product
text: Easy to set up and easy to read.  Love the graph data that is available. No issue with WiFi or signal connection which was one of my concerns when looking at weather stations.  A bit more than I wanted to spend but was very worth it.

title: I’m thrilled with the device, and the app
text: Works great, and very responsive, especially compared to Eve Degree, or even ecobee, which is also a fine product.  These are guys who understand the importance of response time.   The app is also intuitive, with lots of nice features. Worth every penny I paid!

title: Love the eco-system.
text:
Straightforward to setup, accurate, user friendly and the remote modules are all battery powered. 

I have two additional internal modules, the rain and wind gauge as well as an external module -  I’ve just changed the batteries after 18 months and all of the, have been functionally useful me accurate.

title: Great setup.  Usability could be improved, however
text: I have the weather station and a couple of indoor modules.  It works well.  Setup takes some time.  Challenge is that the app is not at all intuitive, nor is adding additional modules.  But it’s one of the better weather stations that I have found in accuracy and flexibility.

title: Satisfied customer
text: We purchased the temperature gauge two years ago and the rain gauge last year. We've been very pleased with these products. They are accurate and have given us no trouble. We would add the wind gauge but neither of us is interested in climbing on the roof.

title: After 10 years
text:
We have max number of units including wind and rain. All working and reporting, no issues. 
Over that time manufacture replaced wind unit, bad battery contact, unit was out of waranty, no issue with support, and email contact process. Great customer service.

title: Disappointed and no customer support available
text: When I first set up my system, everything worked quite well. But, when I have tried to add new components to my system, the app would not recognize them. Then, I was told to download the desktop control program, but that also stopped working. Tried to contact customer support numerous times but no reply. There is no phone number to call. You are directed to Twitter to get customer service. Cool concept, horrible execution.

title: Good but need one detail to be fantastic
text:
The app is stable, easy to read, simple UI! We have 4 units indoor units, the outdoor unit, hygrometer and the digital anemometer, we love it (our neighbors too)
One little detail... It needs to have a refresh option done FROM THE APP, if you are away from the base station and need to refresh the reading remotely... how hard can be to ping and retrieve the data from the base station?

title: First impressions not great
text:
Had high hopes but was worried about reviews. Had problems with setup. Apps not showing any data. Home kit was working for about an hour then my outdoor unit stopped responding. Can’t change unit... what!!! I have the indoor and outdoor unit right next to each other and there is a 4 degree difference in reading.

Update: found how to change the units. But why they choose to have that under my account> personal data is beyond me!

title: Reliable, easy to set up, great support, very useful
text: I’ve had the personal station inside/outside for more than 2 years.  I love it.  I use it several times a day and have opened up its data to Wunderground. You can find my weather station on line.  I can’t wait until I get the wind sensor added to my suite.

title: Good purchase
text: Very accurate electronics, close to a Davis type unit- very expensive stuff.  App has been reliable, the sharing of other locations for outside temp is spot on..  what I expect really a Japanese technology firm.  I’m satisfied.  I’d like to see their wind gauge update much quicker - that’s why I don’t have one.  You won’t regret your purchase.  Mine is about 4 years old- no issues.

title: Great weather station
text: If you are interested in an accurate weather station for a good price the Netatmo system is great.  The wind sensor is a bit unreliable in my opinion, but the rest of the sensors work well. I have been using the full setup for two years now and would recommend it.

title: Great weather station App
text: This app provides a clear concise display of the weather readings from your Netatmo weather station on any device. It also provides graphs of your historical data. Weather forecasts are displayed as well. I’ve been using this app for over a year and have no complaints.

title: Works well
text: A good weather system with only two blemishes. 1) you are limited in the number of sensors it supports. 2) if the app encounters an error reading the current info, it doesn’t automatically try again. This results in stale values until you manually refresh.

title: Poor Equipment Quality
text: I was a loyal Netatmo user for several years. I had trouble with one of the mounting brackets that required adjustment every week or so. The outdoor module burned through a set of batteries every 11 days for two years. I replaced the outdoor module, at my expense, which worked for less than two months before going tango uniform. Customer service effectively blamed it on me. Weather Underground eventually quit including Netatmo systems in their network, which was the last straw. I do not recommend the system or its software.

title: Easy to use
text: Simple to setup, super easy to use.  I love how useful this product is on an every day basis.  Yea, I've read reviews panning netatmo as superfluous but we use it because a) its more accurate than any other weather app, b) we have history, c) indoor readings like humidity is important (winters are too dry here).  I love the product.

title: Great weather station
text: I have been using the Netatmo WeatherStation for seven years now, and it has met every expectation I had. The quality of the product and the accurate temperature and humidity readings make this an ideal home weather station.

title: Excellent product
text: I have several stations with multiple modules for years. However, when changing batteries on older modules, some have defected and was impossible to reconnect (like dead) Had to replace with new modules. Wonder what this could be and if this is not preprogrammed so we keep buying...

title: Excellent for hyper local weather
text: Got the Netatmo for my wife’s birthday. It is accurate and fun. With regard to the wind, you need to adjust the height if you don’t put it up 30 feet. But other than that little trick, setup is a breeze. Now if we could just pronounce the name!

title: Great rain measurement
text: The gauge has worked very well and has only required one battery replacement in a year. The system alerts you when rain is detected, which is a nice feature. If you’re going to have a weather station be sure to add the rain gauge.

title: Really like the historical graphics
text:
Been using it for years and seeing the history for comparison is nice.

Maybe make bigger better one that adds ‘all’ of the air quality measurements, chemical and radon / other gas sensors as well.

title: Stop sending endless notifications!!!!!
text:
This is getting old real fast. Ever since the last update I’ve been receiving endless notifications about some on demand something or other. This is unacceptable. I’m considering putting this thing in the garbage it’s sooo annoying!

Please create an Apple Watch version of this app. 

It's great that this shows the barometric pressure. But it's really only useful if the past 48 hours are displayed in a graph to show the trend. Only then does the barometer help you forecast the weather.

title: Great app
text: The Netatmo weather station is a fantastic set of equipment and the app works perfectly with it. All of the information is there - such as graphs in landscape view. Once you get it it’s fantastic and easy to use. Highly recommended!!

title: Modern and easy to use
text: I looked at everything out on the market when it came to buying a weather station. I purchased the Netatmo for its  modern looks but was pleasantly surprised with the ease of its install and use. Great app and hardware.

title: Enjoying the weather station
text: I’ve enjoyed this weather station. Useful information. Added the rain gauge which has come in handy for figuring out when to water my garden. I give it a 👍.

title: Ruined by stripped features in notifications
text:
Used to be able to set notifications by device. Now you can’t do it by device. 
I have 4 indoor modules and want to set individual notifications by module like I used to.  You can only set notifications now for indoor and or outdoor.

Additionally, to set a high temp notification, it starts at 20 f. They took away the scroll wheel for changing temp so it takes over a minute to select a temp in the 70f range.

title: Best personal weather station
text: It keeps track of real temperature in your house, both outside or inside.  Humidity and barometric pressure as well.  You can now rely on your own weather forecast on not on a 3rd party app located miles away from your own home.

title: No news is good news
text: Always enjoyed this device.  With all the animals and people sleeping in one room (kids), it’s nice to know the CO2 levels.  Never had an issue.  Would LOVE easier integration with Apple Home or Smart Things.  BUT, IFTTT does help.  THANKS!

title: Great insights on weather, and CO2
text: I’ve had this set of hardware and software for about 3 years and have really enjoyed monitoring the weather and the CO2 levels in my home.  I’ve also appreciated the weather alerts provided by Netatmo.  Everyone should have a system.

title: Good app. Needs an Apple Watch applet
text: The app does a good job. My only complaint is there isn’t a way to check temp and other data from my Apple Watch. I don’t generally carry my phone around when I’m home, so it would be nice to be able to just use my watch.

title: Junk
text: This is either junk or defective and if you discover that just outside the short 2 year warranty period, you are out of luck because Netatmo does not stand behind its products. My outdoor weather station AND wind gauge failed, it took weeks for them to diagnose, and even after they determined it was a hardware issue, their “resolution” was BUY A NEW ONE!  I’m not throwing good money after bad esp when there are so many other better options & warn against throwing any money at Netatmo to begin with.

title: Awesome product
text: I know my house is warm while I am traveling. I can look at the temp anywhere I am. 63 degrees inside, and 14 degrees outside right now. I am 3,000 miles away. It is quiet inside, and CO2 levels are low, so I know, no one is in my house while I am gone. Great tool, and very easy to use.

title: Nice UI, Solid Stats
text:
This app has a great UI and is pretty straight forward to use. I just can’t tell how accurate the outdoor module really is.

I would say that about 33% of the time, Weather Underground says that my weather stations info “seems inaccurate”, and then removes my weather station from their map because of it.

title: Extent Weather Station App!
text: Very well though and executed weather app! Very easy to use and it will keep you informed about your home air quality and outside as well ! Very happy with my purchase 👍

title: Great app but need rainfall from yesterday!
text: I love the app and my Netatmo, but the app is sorely missing one metric--what was the rainfall from yesterday? It shows just since 12am (today) which is nice, but I really want to know what the rainfall from yesterday or better yet rainfall in last 24 hrs was.

title: Good to know the weather
text: Enjoying the stations, especially being able to also see the station from friends and family.

title: Great app but a fatal weakness
text: Love the app but firmware upgrades make the app unusable for a remote location - which is the whole point of the app.  A firmware upgrade requires you to physically touch the module.  Fine if it’s in your current location but if it’s remote (say at a  vacation home) the system is dies anytime there is a firmware upgrade.

title: Great weather station
text: Just works. I have two extra sensors, one outdoors and one in a second room. It sends me alerts when I need them, and has a clean and easy to use interface. It also looks good (not like a normal tech device)

title: The best Weather station
text: We love Netatmo. Weather Station. Its the best on the market. You have the possibility to ad different rooms, the Wind Station, the Rain Station and you have all information wherever you are.

title: Working well so far!
text: Only difficulty was in setting up; could not get main unit to log in. Finally got unit working and rest was a breeze! Love being able to see other stations around the country and world.

title: Netatmo
text:
Excellent app, excellent product.
The measuring equipment is very precise and accurate. I have had my Personal Weather Station for three weeks now and I am very happy with this quality product.

title: Same Setup Still Works 4 Years Later
text: We’ve had the same hardware for the last 4 years, and it still works like a charm. I love being able to check on our cats when we’re on vacation.

title: Netatmo Weather
text: Great app. Love being able to check the conditions at me home when I’m away. I wish they would add accumulated rain fall for a month instead of just the past 12 hours. Otherwise, great to have.

title: Intuitive, reliable, informative
text: I have been using a few other products before, but it is first with Netatmo that I find reliable and consistent readings and operation.

title: Rain, measured
text: It does it’s job, without issue.  Both physically and digitally over a 12 month span.  Other apps give more functionality but this does the job.

title: Great app and product
text:

The hardware was easy to install and the app set up easily as we'll. I was taken by surprise at how high the CO2 levels were (4000+ppm), but did then recalled how a high CO2 level was the only bad number in an otherwise stellar blood test I recently had.

title: Great App but a little buggy
text: Installed the App and followed instructions.  iPhone 5S would not connect after 5 attempts.  I connected the main unit via bluetooth in IOS Settings directly and then proceeded with the app setup.  It turns out the app had trouble connecting directly via bluetooth.  After a firmware update, it took about 5 attempts to connect via my WiFi.  I had to restart the main unit 3 times.  Eventually, without changing any settings, it accepted my WiFi.  It has been working fine so far.  I chose not to share my weather data with the world because it shows my exact location.  Thats kind of creepy. If Netatmo would make the location not show up so precisely, I think more people would be willing to share their weather data.  I wouldn’t say this is a simple novice install but I like it.  The hardware is very "Apple like” in its appearance and quality of hardware build.

title: Netatmo Weather Station

I will try to relocate the outdoor module closer to the indoor then try to add the new additional room unit in the room I want to monitor, I would like to have both indoor modules plug-in  to household electricity for ease of using them but I have no idea how long the batteries will power the additional indoor module so I will wait to see how long the batteries work in the extra indoor unit! I will add to this review when I have used these to determine if the battery powered units work long enough to make them worthwhile or I will add another review if I am unable to add to this review.

title: No Support
text:
Purchased product several years ago.  Worked fine until Outdoor Module died 2 weeks ago. Since then, the true worth of this product was revealed. Total lack of any form of support other than automated email responses that regurgitate what is in the manual. No contact support, not even a phone number connecting you to a foreign country tech named "Bob."

Tried to reboot entire system, nada; tried downloading their online app to reinstall, nada; purchased new remote module, could not connect to base station; finally, after 2 weeks of trying, solution is to write this review warning others - do not expect any help if something goes wrong. It is very apparent that once this company sells its product, it could not care less whether it works or not.  This is a buyer beware, what you receive on the order, is all you will get.

title: Good app and product, room for improvement
text:
Can't complain. I've had Netatmo Weather Station for 1.5 years with no issues. Even when my Internet has gone out, the station kept a backlog of updates and uploaded them when connectivity was restored! The app does exactly as advertised, though I could recommend a few feature requests.

Would be nice if there were an Apple Watch app that showed the current temperature as a complication.

Could also use a refresh button in the app that triggers a live reading from the base station. It does no good that you have to be physically present to trigger an update currently.

title: Rough Start-But Outstanding Now
text:
When I first got the weather station it sent me notices every time it updated, just like some of the other reviewers stated. After a 10-day ordeal with the company, they sent me a brand new one. It works great now! It was apparently an issue with the device itself. 

Since I bought this six months ago, they have done nothing but improve the performance and flexibility of the app. The weather station along with the spectacular app make this an outstanding device! I really couldn't be happier with it.

title: Product is great - App seems limited
text:
First, the functionality of the Netatmo sensors and network work great.  Set up easily and reports accurately and dependably. The apps are just OK.  If all you're interested in is looking at the data remotely the apps are fine.  However, if you'd like to look back at your data (highs and lows for instance), you have to find them in your graph or download data.  Also, the app is not very customizable.  You're stuck with RH, but can't look at dew point.  The color CO2 hazard indicator also takes up too much screen real estate. 

I am nitpicking a little here, but these are all fairly easy changes, with data that is already there, so why keep it from us.

title: Pretty great
text: I had a similar experience as some other reviewers in that I received a unit that never registered the outside temp and sent me notifications every few minutes.  I emailed tech support and they sent me a new one with a box to ship the old one back.  Since then, the new unit functioned perfectly.  The app is great, especially the iPad version.  We actually planned my daughter's birthday party after one month of read outs to determine the perfect time so it wasn't too hot.  This is a great device and great app.

title: Good, but has problems
text:
This system and its app are generally very useful. The app has a few problems, however:
1. Opening the window for weather alerts often crashes the app.
2. The window for weather alerts and the text it contains are both too small for easy reading, especially on a phone.
3. In charts, the scale of the Y axis automatically sets itself for the range of data shown at a particular time. The scale is dynamic as you scroll across an extended period of time, with misleading and confusing results. The user should be able to fix the scale.

title: Had mine for a year, works flawlessly
text:

It's hard to believe anyone would down load the app for this product and think you could get atmospheric data inside your house without buying the product. Not a lot of thinkers out there.

title: Love the new update
text:
This app is great. The connection is as reliable as my home internet connection, the push notifications are super helpful and customizable, and I love how you can do things such as manually calibrating the co2 sensor while away from home.
The product itself is of great quality and displays accurate info so long as placement is ideal (definitely don't let the outdoor unit be exposed to direct sunlight as it'll inflate the temperature by ~50*F).
The only reason I did not give this app five stars is because it doesn't have Apple Watch functionality.

title: Firmware updates - NO
text: New 2.0 version apparently DOES NOT show when firmware updates are available.  I have not updated my firmware in months and yet I think a new version is available to support the new Wind Gauge.  Why doesn’t the developer want its users to know about firmware updates?  No emails to registered users about firmware updates, nothing on their web site about firmware updates when they become available, and nothing about firmware updates in the official Netatmo iOS app.  While the app is a good tool (when the weather station has Internet access, which can be a problem during stormy weather), this lack of firmware support really detracts from Netatmo’s product reliability.

title: Awesome, but broken CO2 sensor
text:
I am a total weather geek, and so getting a weather station was perfect for me. It's great to have hyper-local data of the weather broadcasted to me every ten minutes! All of the features work great, although perhaps because of my location far under an overhang my weather station does not respond to sudden weather changes as fast as some other stations in the area.

It does have some issues, the major one for me is that the CO2 sensor always has shown 5000. When I actually tried to have it fixed, the warranty had expired, and it's $79 for another indoor module. I would have loved to know CO2 levels in my house... Another issue I was having for a long time was that it was having problems connecting to the wifi. However, when I moved it to a place where there was a door and a wall instead of two walls between it and the signal, it connected consistently. 

Also, in times of low humidity, it always reads a higher humidity then other stations. When most stations in the area were reading 4-7%, mine read 11%. The pressure readings were too high as well, but I found a solution. I subtracted 90 feet from my altitude in location settings, and it fixed the problem.

I also have gotten the rain gauge, and it works perfectly. I like the graphs that are provided as well, although with the new update they get annoyingly zoomed in every time I leave and come back. Overall though, it's a great weather station and perfect for weather watching.

Please read: Everyone, this app requires a weather station to work, and to calibrate your barometer change your stations altitude in settings - 9 ft is around 0.01 inches of mercury change. Add altitude to increase the readings and subtract altitude to decrease them.
